titleStmt.title: An apologie, or defence, of those Englishe writers [and] preachers which Cerberus the three headed dog of hell, chargeth wyth false doctrine, vnder the name of predestination. Written by Robert Crowley clerke, and vicare of Sainct Giles without Creple-gate in London
titleStmt.author: Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588.

titleStmt.title: An apologie, or defence, of those Englishe writers [and] preachers which Cerberus the three headed dog of hell, chargeth wyth false doctrine, vnder the name of predestination. Written by Robert Crowley clerke, and vicare of Sainct Giles without Creple-gate in London
titleStmt.author: Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Paternoster Rowe, at the signe of the blacke boy, by [H. Denham for] Henry Binneman,

notesStmt.note: A reprinting of and reply to: The copie of an aunswere, made unto a certayne letter.
Running title reads: An apologie of Crowley and others.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
